page.title: 19Improving King's Sutton
page.content: We talked to the retired head-master of the village Primary School. We asked him what changes he would like to see in King's Sutton. He said that there are lovely walks along the River Cherwell and the canal but the villagers cannot get there because the access is privately owned. He wants the farmers to stop planting the footpaths and for all the paths and bridle-tracks to be opened. He would like a Health Clinic, a library (not a mobile one) and a bowling green. When he was head-master he noticed that many of the mothers brought their children to school by car; this caused traffic jams and made the roads dangerous. He would like all the mothers nearby to walk their children to school.
